Generates interactive studio to explain your predictive model
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Generates interactive studio to explain your predictive model

This tool uses your model, data and new observations, to provide local and global explanations. It generates plots and descriptions in the form of serverless HTML site, that supports animations and interactivity made with D3.js.

modelStudio(x, ...)

# S3 method for explainer
modelStudio(x, new_observation, facet_dim = c(2, 2),
  max_features = 10, N = 500, B = 25, time = 1000, ...)

# S3 method for default
modelStudio(x, new_observation, facet_dim = c(2, 2),
  max_features = 10, N = 500, B = 25, time = 1000, data, y,
  predict_function = predict, label = NULL, ...)

Arguments

x

an explainer created with function DALEX::explain() or a model to be explained.
...

other parameters.
new_observation

a new observation with columns that correspond to variables used in the model.
facet_dim

dimensions of the grid. Default is 2x2.
max_features

maximal number of features to be included in BreakDown and FeatureImportance plot.
N

number of observations used for calculation of partial dependency profiles. Default is 500.
B

number of random paths used for calculation of shapley values. Default is 25.
time

in ms. Set animation length. Default is 1000.
data

validation dataset, will be extracted from x if it's an explainer.
y

true labels for data, will be extracted from x if it's an explainer.
predict_function

predict function, will be extracted from x if it's an explainer.
label

a name of the model, will be extracted from x if it's an explainer.

Value

an object of the r2d3 class.

References

ingredients https://modeloriented.github.io/ingredients/ iBreakDown https://modeloriented.github.io/iBreakDown/

Examples

invisible(capture.output({

library("dime")
library("DALEX")

# ex1 classification

titanic <- na.omit(titanic)
set.seed(1313)
titanic_small <- titanic[sample(1:nrow(titanic), 500), c(1,2,3,6,7,9)]

model_titanic_glm <- glm(survived == "yes" ~ gender + age + fare + class + sibsp,
                         data = titanic_small, family = "binomial")

explain_titanic_glm <- explain(model_titanic_glm,
                               data = titanic_small[,-6],
                               y = titanic_small$survived == "yes",
                               label = "glm")

new_observations <- titanic_small[1:4,-6]
rownames(new_observations) <- c("Lisa","James", "Thomas", "Nancy")

modelStudio(explain_titanic_glm, new_observations,
            facet_dim = c(2,3), N = 100, B = 15, time = 0)

# ex2 regression

model_apartments <- glm(m2.price ~. ,
                        data = apartments)

explain_apartments <- explain(model_apartments,
                              data = apartments[,-1],
                              y = apartments[,1])

new_apartments <- apartments[1:2, -1]

modelStudio(explain_apartments, new_apartments, N = 100)

}))
#> Welcome to DALEX (version: 0.4.6).
#> Find examples and detailed introduction at: https://pbiecek.github.io/PM_VEE/
#> Additional features will be available after installation of: ALEPlot, breakDown, pdp, factorMerger.
#> Use 'install_dependencies()' to get all suggested dependencies
